title: The Owl and Fred Jones
creator_contributor_role: Equitable Life Assurance Society, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Change (Psychology)
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Food habits
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Attitude change
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Attitude change
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Attitude change
description: An explanation of how we can control our habits and make them serve us. Fred Jones realises his behaviour is a series of habits - some good, some bad. He would like to change some, like over-eating, but never bothered to try. The owl convinces him that if you want to, if you know how, and if you're willing to work at it, habits can be changed.
